net.sf.jclec.problem.classification.base

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclec.exprtree.fun.ExprTreeFunction
      • net.sf.jclec.problem.classification.base.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.sf.jclec.exprtree.IContext, net.sf.jclec.JCLEC, IClassifier
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CrispRule, FuzzyRule

    public abstract class Rule
extends net.sf.jclec.exprtree.fun.ExprTreeFunction
implements IClassifier
    Classification rule.

    Abstract class that defines a classification rule with an exprTree as the antecedent and a class as the consequent. The rule also keeps the fitness in case it is required beyond the evolutionary process. Main methods: The classify() method classifies a complete dataset and returns the class predictions for all the instances. The covers() method checks whether the antecedent of the rule covers or not a particular instance. The getConfusionMatrix() method classifies a dataset and returns the confusion matrix.

    Author:
    Sebastian Ventura, Amelia Zafra, Jose M. Luna, Alberto Cano, Juan Luis Olmo
    See Also:
